title: (x) southern proper fonts? / Open engraver's caps, monumental Roman caps - Chevalier, Felix {Minimalista}
content:
does anyone know either of these fonts? one is a display for the prep belts and the other is the type for the southern proper logotype

thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 3.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416044723/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%203_111.png) | 69.95 KB |
author: jrwilki

comments.content: Prep looks like [Chevalier](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416044723/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/chevalier/). The the other is so small it's hard to tell.

It looks like they used [Felix](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416044723/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/felix/) and borrowed a U from some other font.

You can see it better here:  
 [http://www.southernproper.com/store/gentlemen/prep-belts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416044723/http:/www.southernproper.com/store/gentlemen/prep-belts.html "http://www.southernproper.com/store/gentlemen/prep-belts.html")

The rest of the site uses [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416044723/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/trajan/)
thanks, felix definitely seems right. I had figured chevalier just after I posted. thanks again
